Names of Tao.quote: The Tao that can be named is not the eternal Tao. (Tao Te Ching 1)

Nature of Tao.quote: The Tao is like a well: used but never used up. (Tao Te Ching 4)

Essence of Tao.quote: The Tao is empty yet inexhaustible. (Tao Te Ching 4)

Tao Principles.quote: The heavy is the root of the light; the still is the master of unrest. (Tao Te Ching 26)

Tao Virtues.quote: The highest good is like water. Water benefits all things and does not compete. (Tao Te Ching 8)

Tao Practice.quote: Do your work, then step back. The only path to serenity. (Tao Te Ching 9)

Tao Unity.quote: Heaven and Earth and I are living together, the ten thousand things and I are one. (Chuang Tzu)

Tao Balance.quote: When people see some things as beautiful, other things become ugly. When people see some things as good, other things become bad. (Tao Te Ching 2)

Tao Wisdom.quote: Knowledge of the eternal is enlightenment. Not knowing it leads to disaster. (Tao Te Ching 16)

Tao Action.quote: Act without doing; work without effort. (Tao Te Ching 63)

Tao Process.quote: The Tao gave birth to One, One gave birth to Two, Two gave birth to Three, Three gave birth to all things. (Tao Te Ching 42)

Tao Nature.quote: Man follows Earth, Earth follows Heaven, Heaven follows the Tao, and the Tao follows what is natural. (Tao Te Ching 25)

Tao Path.quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent upon arriving. (Tao Te Ching 27)

Tao Power.quote: The softest thing in the universe overcomes the hardest thing in the universe. (Tao Te Ching 43)

Tao Leadership.quote: The best leader is one people barely know exists. (Tao Te Ching 17)

Tao Transformation.quote: Returning is the motion of the Tao. (Tao Te Ching 40)

Tao Manifestation.quote: The nameless is the origin of Heaven and Earth. (Tao Te Ching 1)

Tao Paradox.quote: True words seem paradoxical. (Tao Te Ching 78)

Tao Simplicity.quote: Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures. (Tao Te Ching 67)

Tao Harmony.quote: When the great Tao is forgotten, kindness and morality arise. (Tao Te Ching 18)

Tao Mystery.quote: Dark and mysterious, the Tao is the source of all being. (Tao Te Ching 1)

Tao Cultivation.quote: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened. (Tao Te Ching 33)

Tao Emptiness.quote: We join spokes together in a wheel, but it is the center hole that makes the wagon move. (Tao Te Ching 11)

Tao Integration.quote: Heaven, Earth, and human beings are three treasures sharing one body. (Huainanzi)

Tao Cycles.quote: Reversal is the movement of the Tao; weakness is the method of the Tao. (Tao Te Ching 40)

Tao Reality.quote: The Great Tao flows everywhere, both left and right. (Tao Te Ching 34)

Tao Presence.quote: The Tao is always present within you. (Tao Te Ching 6)

Tao Understanding.quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know. (Tao Te Ching 56)

Tao Spontaneity.quote: Act naturally and everything will fall into place. (Chuang Tzu)

Tao Oneness.quote: The ten thousand things carry yin and embrace yang, achieving harmony through blending these forces. (Tao Te Ching 42)
